source.01492017:
# Pandas Exercise 

In this exercise we will be using the [SF Salaries Dataset](https://www.kaggle.com/kaggle/sf-salaries) from Kaggle! Just follow along and complete the tasks outlined in bold below.
source.a2042188: ** What was the average (mean) BasePay of all employees per year? (2011-2014) ? **
source.e3131325: ** Use the .info() method to find out how many entries there are.**
source.ee331e95: ** Read Salaries.csv as a dataframe called sal.**
source.ffd949bd: ** What is the name of lowest paid person (including benefits)? Do you notice something strange about how much he or she is paid?**
source.15b91d9d: ** How many Job Titles were represented by only one person in 2013? (e.g. Job Titles with only one occurence in 2013?) **
source.3b6a7870: ** Check the head of the DataFrame. **
source.1d6ec8a1: ** What are the top 5 most common jobs? **
source.ab87f982: ** How many unique job titles are there? **
source.358f878a: ** How much does JOSEPH DRISCOLL make (including benefits)? **
